name: WiDNR 2016
tagline: Materials for "Introduction to R using the FM Database" Workshop at the WiDNR Statewide Meeting, 8-Mar-16
body:
This half-day workshop will provide an introduction (or reintroduction) to R for fisheries biologists and technicians in the Wisconsin DNR.  The first two hours will introduce basic R concepts and methods for size structure analyses with data from the Fisheries Management Database.  In the second two hours, participants may choose one of two tracks.  The first track will continue with the basic introduction by having participants apply what was learned in the first two hours in a moderated hands-on activity.  The second track will provide participants with an introduction to plotting fisheries data with the ggplot2 R package.

----

## Pre-Workshop Preparation
Perform the following tasks before the workshop.
* **Install R and RStudio** — You will need at least R version 3.1.2 and RStudio version 0.99.XXX for the workshop.  If you participated in a similar workshop last year then you should have adequate versions.  If you did not or have not had R/RStudio installed on your computer then you will need to work with your RIMS to have it installed prior to the workshop.  Directions for installing R/RStudio on a personal computer [are here](http://derekogle.com/IFAR/supplements/).
* **Prepare RStudio** — The default settings for RStudio can be modified for more effective use during the workshop (and after).  My suggested modifications [are here](http://derekogle.com/IFAR/supplements/installations/InstallRStudioWin.html#configuring-rstudio).
* **Install Packages** -- Workshop materials depending on several additional packages being installed for R/Rstudio, including the FSA and fishWiDNR packages.  If you took the workshop last year then these packages need to be updated.  If you did not take the workshop last year then these packages need to be installed.  The directions in [this link](https://github.com/droglenc/fishWiDNR#installation) describe how to install the packages required for the workshop.
* **Getting Started with RStudio** — Review the material in [this link](http://derekogle.com/IFAR/supplements/installations/InstallRStudioWin.html#introducing-rstudio) to get a feel for how to use RStudio for the workshop.
* **Create a Workshop Folder** — Create a folder on your computer that will contain all materials from the workshop (for those described in the next bullet and created at the workshop).
* **Download Data** -- We will use a pull of Raw Fish Data from the Fisheries Management Database in the workshop.  You should download this file from the internal WiDNR server at []() and save it in the folder you created above.
* **Download Script** -- In the first two hours of the workshop you may follow along with the demonstration by running commands provided in [this script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/RcourseWiDNR2016/master/SizeStruc_WT.R).  You should download this material (right-click link and either *"Save As ..."*, *"Save File As ..."*, *"Save Target As ..."*, or *"Save Link as"* depending on your browser) to the folder you created above.
* (*Optional*) **Print Handout** — [This handout](https://github.com/droglenc/RcourseWiDNR2016/raw/master/SizeStruc_WT.pdf) provides written details of the functions and processes for size structure analyses that will be demonstrated with the script above in the workshop.  You may want to print this for reference and to take notes on during the workshop.

Please [contact me](mailto:dogle@northland.edu) with any questions.

----

## Workshop
* **Part I - R Introduction "Lecture"** -- Introduction to basic R concepts and methods for size structure analyses with Sawyer County Raw Fish Data pulled from the Fisheries Management Database.  Participants may follow along "live" with the R script or on the detailed R handout downloaded before the workshop (as descried above).
* **Part II, Track 1 - R Introduction "Hands-On"** -- Participants will develop proficiency with R for size structure analysis of Raw Fish Data from the Fisheries Management Database by completing [this exercise](https://github.com/droglenc/RcourseWiDNR2016/raw/master/SizeStruc_HW.pdf).
* **Part II, Track 2 - ggplot2 Introduction**

----
## Follow-Up
* Please complete this survey regarding this workshop.
* Following the course, please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.
